intro: Caucalis leptophylla var. heterocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically elongated and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. This species is often found in grassy areas and along the edges of woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
